dublinCore.dc:title: HR 5754 ENR: Patient Advocate Tracker Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.congress: One Hundred Seventeenth Congress of the United States of America
form.enrolled-dateline: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Monday, the third day of January, two thousand and twenty-two
form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the ability of veterans to electronically submit complaints about the delivery of health care services by the Department of Veterans Affairs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Patient Advocate Tracker Act.

section.header: System for electronic submission of complaints about the delivery of health care services by the Department of Veterans Affairs
section.text: Section 7309A(c) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: Beginning not later than 18 months after the date of the enactment of this paragraph, the Director shall establish an information technology system that will allow a veteran (or the designated representative of a veteran) to electronicallyâ€”

subparagraph.text: file a complaint that will be received by the appropriate patient advocate; and
at any time view the status of the complaint, including interim and final actions that have been taken to address the complaint.

attestation-group.role: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.
